title: Louis Tomlinson announces Australian tour dates
text:
He's been focusing on his solo music career since One Direction went on 'hiatus' almost four years ago.

And now Louis Tomlinson is finally embarking on his own headline tour, and it's heading Down Under.

On Thursday, the 27-year-old made the announcement with accompanying dates on Instagram.

He's coming: On Thursday, Louis Tomlinson (pictured) announced his first solo world tour which will see him play dates in Sydney and Melbourne

He captioned the post: 'Been waiting for this moment since I started my solo career. Can't wait to see you all on tour. There are also a few more dates going up at a later date.'

The Louis Tomlinson World Tour kicks off in Barcelona, Spain on March 9, 2020.

He will play Sydney on April 25, before hitting the stage in Melbourne on April 27.

The singer is yet to announce dates in Perth, Brisbane or Adelaide.

So talented: The Louis Tomlinson World Tour kicks off in Barcelona, Spain on March 9, 2020. The singer will play Sydney on April 25, before hitting the stage in Melbourne on April 27

Earlier this month, Louis told Stellar magazine what he misses most about his days in One Direction - a band formed on the British version of The X Factor in 2010.

'The buzz from writing a great song and sharing that experience together, doing the shows... I definitely miss that the most,' Louis told Stellar.

In September, Louis admitted on Australian radio show Smallzy's Surgery that he and his bandmates used to spread fake news while on tour.

'When I was in One Direction, sometimes we just used to make up different people that Niall had slept with on tour, I think we'll just go with that!' he confessed.

Niall has previously been linked to Hailee Steinfeld, model Barbara Palvin, Ellie Goulding, and more recently Selena Gomez.

Louis' new single, We Made It, is out now. His debut solo album will be released in early 2020
